title: Public Procurement Contract Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for high-level types of public procurement contracts.

terms.label: Concession
terms.definition: A contract in which a private party receives the right to exploit works or services and derives remuneration from users rather than from direct public payments.

terms.label: Framework Agreement
terms.definition: A contract establishing a framework under which specific call-offs, orders, or mini-competitions may take place over time.

terms.label: Other Contract Type
terms.definition: A contract type that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary.

terms.label: Services
terms.definition: A contract whose primary purpose is the provision of services, including professional, technical, or operational services.

terms.label: Supplies
terms.definition: A contract whose primary purpose is the purchase, lease, rental, or hire of goods or supplies.

terms.label: Works
terms.definition: A contract whose primary purpose is the execution, completion, or design of construction or civil engineering works.
